translated: The difficult-to-cure erysipelas are those that arise from wounds, from the humors, and from all the vital points being covered, as well as those with a smell like rotten flesh, pus, or a corpse.🔽The two types of erysipelas that arise from wounds or from vital points, and those that arise from a combination of the humors are difficult to cure.

original: thams cad de nad gzhi tha dad pa dang nad gzhi gnyis las byung ba'i me dbal thams cad kyang gnad rnams khebs shing khyab pa ni gso dka' la ;

analyzed: de nas phyir ni 'byung 'gyur te //

analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: zas dang spyod lam log pa ste //

analyzed: zas grang ches pa dang tsha ches pa dang / ya ba ka la sogs pa zos pa dang / de bzhin du spyod pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par du 'gal ba'i spyod pa byed cing /

analyzed: rnam par 'tshe zhing gzhan la gnod pa dang / tshig rtsub por smra ba dang / gzhan la gnod par sems pa ste /

translated: You have committed nonvirtuous actions with your body, speech, and mind, and have committed negative actions such as disparaging holy beings. You have committed these actions in the present life, and you have also committed them in the past and have become habituated to them.

analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi tshogs rnams bslang zhing bskyed nas gnod par gyur pa rtsa la thad kar gram zhing zhugs nas /

analyzed: pags pa la sogs pa la gnod par byas shing nad bskyed nas sla zhing zhum par byas nas /

analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu nad de rnams phyi rol tu byung zhing thon par 'gyur te /

analyzed: pags pa'i mdog mi sdug cing snga ma las gzhan du gyur pa'i mdog du mar byed pa'i nad de ni mdze zhes bya'o //

analyzed: zhes drang srong chen po rgyun shes kyi bu la sogs pas bshad do //

analyzed: gang phyir dus las yal bar bor //

original: de ni lus kun ma rungs 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni lus kun ma rungs 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /

original: ci'i phyir mdze zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdze zhes bya zhe na /

original: gang gi phyir rang gi gso ba'i @169a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi gso ba'i @169a * //

analyzed: dus la bab pa de las yal bar bor zhing gso bar ma byas na nad de las thams cad ma rung zhing gnod par byed pas na de'i phyir ming mdze zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: If one ignores it and does not treat it when the time comes, that disease will make everything bad and harmful. Therefore, it is explained that the name “leprosy” is given.

original: lus zungs la zhugs nang du khyab //
analyzed: lus zungs la zhugs nang du khyab //
translated: Having entered the body constituents, it spreads inside.

original: thams cad 'drul bar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad 'drul bar byed par 'gyur //

original: rdul bcas rul zhing mnam pa dang // srin bu phra mo mi bzad skyed //
analyzed: rdul bcas rul zhing mnam pa dang // srin bu phra mo mi bzad skyed //

analyzed: spu lpags chu ba rtsa chen dang // rus pa snyi ba rim bzhin za //

analyzed: de bas sha bkra phyi rol te // mdze las gzhan ni yin par bshad //

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: It is explained to be different from leprosy.

translated: With regard to that, having entered all the body constituents such as the lymph, it spreads inside and causes all those body constituents to rot and become moist, producing worms in the body.

original: 'bu de yang shin tu phra ba dang / mi bzad cing brnag par dka' ba'i nad skyed par byed pa des spu la sogs pa za bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'bu de yang shin tu phra ba dang / mi bzad cing brnag par dka' ba'i nad skyed par byed pa des spu la sogs pa za bar byed cing /
translated: The worm is extremely small and causes an unbearable and difficult to cure disease that eats the hair and so on.

original: rus pa snyi ba'i rna ba dang sna'i phyogs na gnas pa'i rus pa mnyen pa la bya ste de dag za bar byed do //
analyzed: rus pa snyi ba'i rna ba dang sna'i phyogs na gnas pa'i rus pa mnyen pa la bya ste de dag za bar byed do //
translated: It is located in the soft bone of the ear and nose, and it eats the soft bone.

original: de bas rgyu de'i phyir sha bkra la ni 'drul ba dang 'bu la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: de bas rgyu de'i phyir sha bkra la ni 'drul ba dang 'bu la sogs pa med de /
translated: Therefore, because of that cause, there is no scabies, itch, or worms in leprosy.

original: de pags pa'i phyi rol du gnas pa ni mdze las gzhan pa yin no zhes drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: de pags pa'i phyi rol du gnas pa ni mdze las gzhan pa yin no zhes drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: The sages explain that it is different from leprosy because it is located outside the skin.

original: nad gzhi gsum dang 'dres pa dang // 'dus gyur mdze nad rnam pa bdun //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad gzhi gsum dang 'dres pa dang // 'dus gyur mdze nad rnam pa bdun // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three combined, the seven types of leprosy.

original: mdze nad ni rnam pa bdun yod de /
analyzed: mdze nad ni rnam pa bdun yod de /
translated: There are seven types of leprosy.

original: nad gzhi tha dad pa rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan las gyur pa gsum dang / nyes pa de dag nyid sna gnyis gnyis 'dres pa las gyur pa gsum dang / de gsum char 'dus pa las gyur pa gcig ste de ltar bdun no //
analyzed: nad gzhi tha dad pa rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan las gyur pa gsum dang / nyes pa de dag nyid sna gnyis gnyis 'dres pa las gyur pa gsum dang / de gsum char 'dus pa las gyur pa gcig ste de ltar bdun no //
translated: There are three types of leprosy, arising from wind, bile, and phlegm disorders. There are three types of leprosy, arising from the combination of two of these humors. There is one type of leprosy, arising from the combination of all three humors. Thus there are seven types of leprosy.

original: kun kyang nyes gsum las byung yang //🔽de las lhag pa las ming 'dogs //
analyzed: kun kyang nyes gsum las byung yang // de las lhag pa las ming 'dogs //
translated: All of them arise from the three humors,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: mdze nad kun kyang nad gzhi gsum las gyur pa yin mod kyi /

analyzed: de las nyes pa gang shas che zhing lhag par gnas pa las rlung las gyur pa la sogs pa'i ming du 'dogs pa yin no //

analyzed: rlung gi mdze ni thod pa 'dra // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Wind leprosy is like a skull.

original: rlung gi shas che ba'i 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rims ni thod pa 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi shas che ba'i 'dus pa las gyur pa'i rims ni thod pa 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: A type of leprosy that arises from a predominance of wind is called “skull-like.”

original: mkhris @169b gyur au dum b'a ra ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris @169b gyur au dum b'a ra ste //🔽zhes bya ba la /

translated: The fever that results from a combination in which bile predominates is called udumbara.

translated: The leprosy that results from a combination in which phlegm predominates is called leprosy with roundish spots and leprosy with spots like elephant's nostrils.

analyzed: rlung mkhris las skyes ri shya'i lce // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa gnyis shas che ba las ni ri shya'i lce zhes bya ba'i mdze nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The leprosy that results from a combination in which phlegm and wind predominate is called leprosy with a single skin and leprosy with small pox and leprosy with white spots and leprosy with abscesses and leprosy with lymph.

original: bad kan mkhris pa las byung ba //
analyzed: bad kan mkhris pa las byung ba //
translated: The leprosy that results from a combination in which phlegm and bile predominate is called leprosy with a rough tongue.

original: shu ba rma kha brgya ba dang // padma dkar po 'brum bur bcas //
analyzed: shu ba rma kha brgya ba dang // padma dkar po 'brum bur bcas //
translated: And a hundred open sores,🔽And a white lotus with pustules,

original: g-yan pa pags pa myags pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽bad kan dang mkhris pa gnyis shas che ba las gyur pa'i mdze nad ni shu ba la sogs pa drug 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yan pa pags pa myags pa'o // zhes bya ba la / bad kan dang mkhris pa gnyis shas che ba las gyur pa'i mdze nad ni shu ba la sogs pa drug 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The six types of leprosy are: the white leprosy, the red leprosy, the black leprosy, the pustular leprosy, the white lotus leprosy, and the white leprosy with pustules.🔽The seven types of skin disease are: the scabies, the eczema, the ringworm, the itch, the pustules, the carbuncles, and the dry leprosy.🔽The six types of leprosy are: the white leprosy, the red leprosy, the black leprosy, the pustular leprosy, the white lotus leprosy, and the white leprosy with pustules.

original: 'dus pa las gyur 'ol ma se //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur 'ol ma se // zhes bya ba la /

original: tshigs gnas lhag par tshigs 'drul skem //🔽rkang pa 'jas 'gyur tshil gnas pa //🔽yan lag zhig par byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs gnas lhag par tshigs 'drul skem // rkang pa 'jas 'gyur tshil gnas pa // yan lag zhig par byed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one that resides in the flesh causes the appearance of pustules on the feet and hands.

original: tshigs rnams la gnas pa'i mdze nad ni lhag par tshigs 'drul zhing rnag pa dang / skem zhing rid pa dang / rkang pa 'jas shing 'gro mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs rnams la gnas pa'i mdze nad ni lhag par tshigs 'drul zhing rnag pa dang / skem zhing rid pa dang / rkang pa 'jas shing 'gro mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one that resides in the joints causes the joints to become loose, to be filled with pus, to waste away, and to become thin.

original: tshil la gnas pa'i mdze ni lus kyi yan lag gi tshogs zhig cing 'drul bar 'gyur @173a * //
analyzed: tshil la gnas pa'i mdze ni lus kyi yan lag gi tshogs zhig cing 'drul bar 'gyur @173a * //
translated: The one that resides in the fat causes the body to become emaciated.

original: ro ; / rus pa rkang gnas sna zhom zhing //
analyzed: ro ; / rus pa rkang gnas sna zhom zhing //
translated: The one that resides in the bones causes the nose to become flat.

original: mig dmar skad ni 'gags pa dang // rma la 'bu zhugs /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig dmar skad ni 'gags pa dang // rma la 'bu zhugs / zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eyes become red, the voice is obstructed, and worms enter the wounds.

original: rus pa dang rkang la zhugs pa'i mdze nad ni sna zhom zhing nyams pa dang / mig gnyis dmar zhing sle sle por 'gyur ba dang ; / skad 'gags shing subs pa dang / rma la 'bu zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rus pa dang rkang la zhugs pa'i mdze nad ni sna zhom zhing nyams pa dang / mig gnyis dmar zhing sle sle por 'gyur ba dang ; / skad 'gags shing subs pa dang / rma la 'bu zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, leprosy that resides in the bones and marrow causes the nose to collapse and deteriorate, the two eyes become red and sunken, the voice is obstructed and muffled, and worms enter the wounds.

original: khu bar gnas /
analyzed: khu bar gnas /
translated: Residing in the semen,

original: bu dang chung mar bcas la 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bu dang chung mar bcas la 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it arises in the sons and wives.

original: mdze nad khu chu la gnas pa ni rang gi bu dang chung ma dang bcas pa la mdze 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽khrag sogs la ni rim bzhin du //
analyzed: mdze nad khu chu la gnas pa ni rang gi bu dang chung ma dang bcas pa la mdze 'byung bar 'gyur ro // khrag sogs la ni rim bzhin du //
translated: Here, leprosy that resides in the semen arises in one's sons and wives.

original: mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽khrag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / khrag la sogs pa ste /
translated: In blood and so on, all the signs arise in order.🔽Here, in blood and so on, all the signs arise in order.

original: khrag dang sha dang tshil dang rus pa dang rkang dang khu ba rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khrag dang sha dang tshil dang rus pa dang rkang dang khu ba rnams la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In blood, flesh, fat, bones, marrow, and semen, all the signs arise in order.

original: khrag la sogs pa ni khu ba'i gong na gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: khrag la sogs pa ni khu ba'i gong na gnas pa yin te /
translated: Blood and so on are located above the lymph.

original: des na lus zungs gang la gnas pa'i mdze nad gong ma gang yin pa de la de'i mtshan ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: des na lus zungs gang la gnas pa'i mdze nad gong ma gang yin pa de la de'i mtshan ma 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the signs of the leprosy that is located in a bodily constituent appear in that bodily constituent.

original: des na khrag la gnas pa'i mdze nad la pags pa'i mtshan ma zug pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /🔽ma zhu ba'i gnas la gnas pa'i mdze la ni pags pa dang khrag gi mtshan ma 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na khrag la gnas pa'i mdze nad la pags pa'i mtshan ma zug pa la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la / ma zhu ba'i gnas la gnas pa'i mdze la ni pags pa dang khrag gi mtshan ma 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, in leprosy located in the blood, the signs of the skin, such as pain, appear.🔽In leprosy located in the place of undigested food, the signs of the skin and blood appear.

original: tshil la gnas pa ni pags pa dang khrag dang sha la gnas pa'i mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshil la gnas pa ni pags pa dang khrag dang sha la gnas pa'i mtshan ma 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In leprosy located in the fat, the signs of the skin, blood and flesh appear.

original: de bzhin du khu ba la gnas pa'i mdze la mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du khu ba la gnas pa'i mdze la mtshan ma thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In leprosy located in the lymph, all the signs appear.

original: de ltar mdze nad bshad nas ;
analyzed: de ltar mdze nad bshad nas ;
translated: Having explained leprosy in this way,

original: da ni sha bkra gzi gu'i nad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sha bkra gzi gu'i nad bshad par bya ste /
translated: now we will explain the disease of vitiligo.

original: gzi gu mdze dang gcig las 'byung //🔽de ni sha bkra chu dang ni //
analyzed: gzi gu mdze dang gcig las 'byung // de ni sha bkra chu dang ni //
translated: Vitiligo arises from one of the same causes as leprosy.🔽It is explained as “the loss of skin color”

original: yongs su 'dzag pa zhes byar bshad //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzag pa zhes byar bshad //
translated: and “the complete loss of moisture.”

original: nad gzhi gsum la brten zhing 'byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad gzhi gsum la brten zhing 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It arises in dependence on three humors.

original: sha bkra'i nad gzi gu ni mdze nad dang nad gzhi gcig pa yin zhing /
analyzed: sha bkra'i nad gzi gu ni mdze nad dang nad gzhi gcig pa yin zhing /
translated: The disease known as “white spot” is the same as leprosy.

original: de bzhin du gnod pa dang gnod bya la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig pa yin no //🔽de'i ming ni sha bkra gzi gu dang / chu dang yongs su mi 'dzag pa zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod pa dang gnod bya la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig pa yin no // de'i ming ni sha bkra gzi gu dang / chu dang yongs su mi 'dzag pa zhes bya bar slob dpon gyis bshad do //
translated: Similarly, the disease known as “white spot” is the same as the disease known as “white spot.”🔽The teacher explains that the disease known as “white spot” is also called “white spot,” “white spot,” and “white spot.”

original: de yang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad gzhi @173b gsum la brten cing nad gang khrag dang sha dang tshil gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag la brten cing 'byung ba yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad gzhi @173b gsum la brten cing nad gang khrag dang sha dang tshil gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag la brten cing 'byung ba yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “white spot” because it arises in dependence on the three humors of wind, bile, and phlegm, and because it arises in dependence on blood, flesh, and fat.

original: rlung las rtsub cing smug pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rlung las rtsub cing smug pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one arising from wind is rough and brown.

original: rlung las gyur pa'i sha bkra gzi gu ni reg na rtsub cing kha dog smug pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung las gyur pa'i sha bkra gzi gu ni reg na rtsub cing kha dog smug pa yin no //
translated: The white spot arising from wind is rough to the touch and brown in color.

original: mkhris gyur padma'i 'dab ltar dmar //
analyzed: mkhris gyur padma'i 'dab ltar dmar //
translated: The one arising from bile is red like a lotus petal.

original: tsha zhing ba spu 'byi bar byed //
analyzed: tsha zhing ba spu 'byi bar byed //
translated: It is hot and causes itching.

original: ces bya ba la /🔽mkhris pa las gyur pa'i sha bkra ni padma'i 'dab ma ltar shin tu dmar ba dang tsha ba dang bcas shing spu 'byi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la / mkhris pa las gyur pa'i sha bkra ni padma'i 'dab ma ltar shin tu dmar ba dang tsha ba dang bcas shing spu 'byi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: 1.1.1.2. The one born from bile is very red, like lotus petals, and is accompanied by heat and itching.

original: bad kan las skya stug cing lci //🔽g-ya' bcas / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bad kan las skya stug cing lci // g-ya' bcas / zhes bya ba la /
translated: 1.1.1.3. The one born from phlegm is thick, heavy, and accompanied by itching.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i sha bkra ni stug cing lci ba dang g-ya' ba dang bcas pa yin no //🔽rim bzhin khrag dang ni //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i sha bkra ni stug cing lci ba dang g-ya' ba dang bcas pa yin no // rim bzhin khrag dang ni //
translated: 1.1.1.4. The one born from wind is thin, light, and moves about.

original: sha dang tshil la brten par bshad //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽sha bkra gzi gu de ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sha la sogs pa la brten par bshad de /
analyzed: sha dang tshil la brten par bshad // ces bya ba la / sha bkra gzi gu de ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sha la sogs pa la brten par bshad de /
translated: 1.1.2. They are explained as being based on blood, flesh, and fat, respectively.

original: de la rlung las ni khrag la brten pa yin no //🔽mkhris pa las ni sha la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rlung las ni khrag la brten pa yin no // mkhris pa las ni sha la brten pa yin no //
translated: 1.1.2.1. The one born from wind is based on blood.🔽1.1.2.2. The one born from bile is based on flesh.

original: bad kan las ni tshil la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las ni tshil la brten pa yin no //
translated: 1.1.2.3. The one born from phlegm is based on fat.

original: 'di dag mdog ni gnyis ka yin //
analyzed: 'di dag mdog ni gnyis ka yin //
translated: 1.1.3. They are both colors.🔽1.1.3.1. The one born from bile is red.🔽1.1.3.2. The one born from phlegm is white.🔽1.1.3.3. The one born from wind is black.

original: de ni phyi ma bzhin gso dka' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni phyi ma bzhin gso dka' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: 1.1.4. They are difficult to cure, like the latter.🔽1.1.4.1. The one born from bile is difficult to cure.🔽1.1.4.2. The one born from phlegm is difficult to cure.🔽1.1.4.3. The one born from wind is difficult to cure.

original: sha bkra 'di dag gi mdog ni gnyis ka la brten pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin te /🔽khrag la brten na ni kha dog gnag pa yin la /
analyzed: sha bkra 'di dag gi mdog ni gnyis ka la brten pa'i dbye bas phye ba yin te / khrag la brten na ni kha dog gnag pa yin la /
translated: The color of these vitiligo patches is distinguished by the classification based on both [blood and flesh].🔽If [the vitiligo] is based on blood, the color is dark.

original: sha la brten na ni zangs ltar dmar ba yin la /
analyzed: sha la brten na ni zangs ltar dmar ba yin la /
translated: If [the vitiligo] is based on flesh, it is copper-colored.

original: tshil la brten na ni dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: tshil la brten na ni dkar ba yin no //
translated: If [the vitiligo] is based on fat, it is white.

original: de yang phyi ma bzhin du gso dka' ste /
analyzed: de yang phyi ma bzhin du gso dka' ste /
translated: Moreover, [the vitiligo] is difficult to cure if it is based on the latter.

original: khrag dang rlung las byung ba bas ni sha dang mkhris pa las byung ba gso dka' la ;🔽de bas ni tshil la brten pa nas /
analyzed: khrag dang rlung las byung ba bas ni sha dang mkhris pa las byung ba gso dka' la ; de bas ni tshil la brten pa nas /
translated: [The vitiligo] that arises from blood and wind is more difficult to cure than [the vitiligo] that arises from flesh and bile.🔽[The vitiligo] that arises from fat is more difficult to cure than that.

original: bad kan las byung ba shin tu gso dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: bad kan las byung ba shin tu gso dka' ba yin no //
translated: [The vitiligo] that arises from phlegm is very difficult to cure.🔽If the white hair is not thick,

original: spu dkar ma yin srab pa dang // phan tshun ma 'dres gsar du byung //
analyzed: spu dkar ma yin srab pa dang // phan tshun ma 'dres gsar du byung //
translated: not mixed with each other, and newly arisen,

original: mes ma bsregs pa gso bar sla //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mes ma bsregs pa gso bar sla //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: and not burned by fire, it is easy to cure.

original: sha bkra'i nad gang spu dkar ba ma yin pa dang / srab cing zabs su chung ba dang / phan tshun gcig la gcig ma 'dres pa dang / skyes nas ring por ma lon pa dang / mes bsregs pa las byung ba ma yin pa ni gso bar sla'o //
analyzed: sha bkra'i nad gang spu dkar ba ma yin pa dang / srab cing zabs su chung ba dang / phan tshun gcig la gcig ma 'dres pa dang / skyes nas ring por ma lon pa dang / mes bsregs pa las byung ba ma yin pa ni gso bar sla'o //
translated: A skin disease that is not white hair, that is thin and shallow, that is not mixed together, that is not long since arisen, and that is not produced from burning by fire is easy to cure.

original: de las gzhan pa gso dka' yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gso dka' yin //
translated: The opposite of that is difficult to cure.

original: mdoms dang lag mthil mthur byung ba //🔽gsar @174a * //
analyzed: mdoms dang lag mthil mthur byung ba // gsar @174a * //
translated: Arisen on the genitals, palms, or soles,

original: du byung yang gso bar dka' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: du byung yang gso bar dka' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: even if new, is difficult to cure.

original: sngar bshad pa de las gzhan pa ba spu dkar ba dang mthug pa dang phan tshun 'dres pa dang yun ring po lon pa dang / mes bsregs pa las byung ba yin na ni gso dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa de las gzhan pa ba spu dkar ba dang mthug pa dang phan tshun 'dres pa dang yun ring po lon pa dang / mes bsregs pa las byung ba yin na ni gso dka' ba yin no //
translated: Here, the opposite of what was explained above—white hair, thick, mixed together, long since arisen, and produced from burning by fire—is difficult to cure.

original: de bzhin du mdoms la sogs par byung ba ni gsar du byung ba yin na yang gso bar dka' bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdoms la sogs par byung ba ni gsar du byung ba yin na yang gso bar dka' bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Similarly, even if it is new, it is difficult to cure if it arises on the genitals and so on, and so it should be abandoned.

original: nad rnams phal cher zas dang ni //
analyzed: nad rnams phal cher zas dang ni //
translated: Most diseases are due to diet and lifestyle,

original: mal gcig reg sogs la brten nas //
analyzed: mal gcig reg sogs la brten nas //
translated: All [diseases] are transmitted by contact with a bed, etc.

original: thams cad 'go ste mig nad dang // mdze nad lhag par 'go ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad 'go ste mig nad dang // mdze nad lhag par 'go ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: [But] eye diseases and leprosy are especially contagious.

original: nad phal cher te /
analyzed: nad phal cher te /
translated: The majority of diseases

original: mang du 'go ba'i ngang tshul can yin zhing lus las lus su 'pho ba yin te /
analyzed: mang du 'go ba'i ngang tshul can yin zhing lus las lus su 'pho ba yin te /
translated: are of a contagious nature and are transmitted from one body to another.

original: ji ltar 'pho zha na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'pho zha na /
translated: How are they transmitted?

original: zas lhan cig zos pa la sogs pas 'pho ste /
analyzed: zas lhan cig zos pa la sogs pas 'pho ste /
translated: They are transmitted by eating food together, etc.

original: gang gi che nad pa dang lhan cig tu za zhing mal gcig tu nyal ba dang reg pa la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: gang gi che nad pa dang lhan cig tu za zhing mal gcig tu nyal ba dang reg pa la sogs pa byas na /
translated: If one eats with a sick person, sleeps on the same bed, or has physical contact with them,

original: de'i tshe nad med pa'i mi la yang nad thams cad ma lus par 'pho ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe nad med pa'i mi la yang nad thams cad ma lus par 'pho ba yin mod kyi /
translated: then all the diseases without exception are transmitted to the healthy person.

original: de las kyang khyad par mdze nad la sogs pa pags pa'i nad dang / mig gi nad ni shas cher 'pho zhing 'go ba yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang khyad par mdze nad la sogs pa pags pa'i nad dang / mig gi nad ni shas cher 'pho zhing 'go ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, among them, skin diseases such as leprosy and eye diseases are especially contagious and are transmitted.

original: sha bkra gzi gu'i nad bshad nas //
analyzed: sha bkra gzi gu'i nad bshad nas //
translated: Having explained the disease of vitiligo,

original: da ni srin bu'i nad bshad de //
analyzed: da ni srin bu'i nad bshad de //
translated: now the disease of worms will be explained.

original: phyi dang nang gi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division into external and internal,

original: srin bu rnam pa gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: srin bu rnam pa gnyis su bshad //
translated: worms are explained as being of two types.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /

original: srin bu'i nad ni phyi na gnas pa dang nang na gnas pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: srin bu'i nad ni phyi na gnas pa dang nang na gnas pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: The worm-diseases are of two kinds, according to whether they are located outside or inside.

original: zhes bya ba mngon bar shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba mngon bar shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i drang srong rnams kyis bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained by the sages who possess the five superknowledges.

original: phyi yi dri mas bad kan khrag / bshang skyes dbye bas rnam bzhi yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi yi dri mas bad kan khrag / bshang skyes dbye bas rnam bzhi yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The external ones are of four kinds, according to whether they are born from phlegm, blood, or excrement.

original: srin bu'i nad ni skye gnas kyi dbye bas rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: srin bu'i nad ni skye gnas kyi dbye bas rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Here, the worm-diseases are of four kinds, according to the place of their origin.

original: la la ni phyi'i dri ma las skyes pa yin no //🔽la la ni bad kan las skyes pa yin no //🔽la la ni khrag las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: la la ni phyi'i dri ma las skyes pa yin no // la la ni bad kan las skyes pa yin no // la la ni khrag las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Some are born from external dirt.🔽Some are born from phlegm.🔽Some are born from blood.

original: la la ni bshang ba las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: la la ni bshang ba las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Some are born from excrement.

original: ming las rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming las rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are twenty in number, according to their names.

original: ming gi dbye ba'i gnas bshang ba rnams kyis de rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ming gi dbye ba'i gnas bshang ba rnams kyis de rnam pa nyi shur 'gyur ro //
translated: The worm-diseases are twenty in number, according to the different names of the excrement in which they originate.

original: de la phyi yi khrag las byung //
analyzed: de la phyi yi khrag las byung //
translated: Among them, the external ones are born from blood.

original: tshad dbyibs mdog ni til 'bru 'dra //
analyzed: tshad dbyibs mdog ni til 'bru 'dra //
translated: They are the size of sesame seeds, and their color is like that of sesame seeds.

original: skra dang gos la brten pa yin //
analyzed: skra dang gos la brten pa yin //
translated: They are based on hair and clothing.

original: phra zhing rkang pa mang la @174b ming ;
analyzed: phra zhing rkang pa mang la @174b ming ;
translated: They are small, have many legs,

original: / shig dang sro ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / shig dang sro ma zhes bya'o //
translated: and are called lice and nits.🔽Both cause the arising of boils,

original: gnyis kas thor bu 'brum bu dang // g-yan pa dag ni skyed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis kas thor bu 'brum bu dang // g-yan pa dag ni skyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and scabies.

original: de la srin bu de rnams kyi nang nas phyi'i srin bu ni khrag dri ma can las byung ste /
analyzed: de la srin bu de rnams kyi nang nas phyi'i srin bu ni khrag dri ma can las byung ste /
translated: Among these worms, the external worms arise from impure blood.

original: gang gi tshe khrus la sogs pas dag par ma byas pa de'i tshe shig la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khrus la sogs pas dag par ma byas pa de'i tshe shig la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one does not purify oneself by bathing and so forth, lice and so on arise.

original: de yang tshad dang dbyibs dang mdog ni til 'bru lta bu yin la /
analyzed: de yang tshad dang dbyibs dang mdog ni til 'bru lta bu yin la /
translated: They are the size of sesame seeds, and their shape and color are like that.

original: gnas ni skra dang gos la brten cing 'dug la /
analyzed: gnas ni skra dang gos la brten cing 'dug la /
translated: They are based on and dwell in hair and clothing.

original: lus ni phra zhing rkang pa mang ba yin la /
analyzed: lus ni phra zhing rkang pa mang ba yin la /
translated: Their bodies are small and have many legs.

original: de'i ming ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i ming ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They have two names:

original: shig ces bya ba dang / sro ma zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shig ces bya ba dang / sro ma zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: lice and nits.

original: des kyang lus la thor bu la sogs pa skyed cing 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: des kyang lus la thor bu la sogs pa skyed cing 'byung bar byed do //
translated: They cause boils and so on to arise and appear on the body.

analyzed: srog la sogs pa rlung lnga po dag ni phan tshun 'khrugs shing sgrib par byed pa dang / 'khrugs par byas pa'i tshul gyis nad skyed pas phan tshun gcig la gcig @188b 'dres shing bsgribs la 'khrugs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The five winds, life, etc., generate illness by mutually disturbing, obscuring, and disturbing each other, and thus they are mixed, obscured, and disturbed by each other.

analyzed: mkhris pa la sogs bcu gnyis dang // 'dres par gyur te 'dren ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: srog ces bya ba la sogs pa rlung lnga po de dag nad bcu gnyis lus zungs drug dang / khrag dang zas dang bshang ba dang / gci ba dang 'dres pa ste /

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //

original: 'dres pa de ni 'dren ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dres pa de ni 'dren ma yin te /

analyzed: srog ces bya ba'i rlung de la sogs pa de dag gis 'dres par gyur na 'dren ma yin te /
translated: When those winds, called life-force, etc., are mixed, they are a combination.

original: phan tshun 'dre bar byed pa dang / 'dre bar bya ba'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dre bar byed pa dang / 'dre bar bya ba'i ngo bor gnas pa yin no //

original: mkhris pa sogs las 'dres /🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris pa sogs las 'dres / zhes bya ba la /

original: mkhris pa la sogs pa gnyis la sogs par phrad pa'i 'dres par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa la sogs pa gnyis la sogs par phrad pa'i 'dres par gyur pa'o //
translated: The mixture is the combination of two or more bile, etc.

original: de bzhin // 'dren ma rnam pa du ma yin //🔽rab dang rab mchog brtags pa yis //🔽'dres pa grangs med 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de bzhin // 'dren ma rnam pa du ma yin // rab dang rab mchog brtags pa yis // 'dres pa grangs med 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Similarly, there are many combinations.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The combinations are innumerable, due to the variations of the best, best-of-the-best, etc.

original: de dang mtshungs pas na de bzhin te /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs pas na de bzhin te /
translated: That is similar to that, so it is similarly.

original: srog ces bya ba'i rlung la sogs pa dang / mkhris pa la sogs pa de dang 'dres par gyur pa rnam pa mang pos nad kyi 'dren ma ni rnam pa du ma yin te /
analyzed: srog ces bya ba'i rlung la sogs pa dang / mkhris pa la sogs pa de dang 'dres par gyur pa rnam pa mang pos nad kyi 'dren ma ni rnam pa du ma yin te /
translated: The many types of diseases are the many types of combinations of the life-force wind and so forth, and bile and so forth.

analyzed: grangs med par 'gyur ba dang / rab dang rab mchog gi dbye ba'i brtags pas grangs med par 'gyur te /
translated: They are innumerable because of the enumeration of the various types of increase.

original: srog la sogs pa dang mkhris pa la sogs pa cung zad rab tu lhag pa dang / rab mchog tu lhag pa ste /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang mkhris pa la sogs pa cung zad rab tu lhag pa dang / rab mchog tu lhag pa ste /
translated: The life-force wind and so forth, and bile and so forth, are slightly increased and greatly increased.

original: de ltar brtags pa rnam pa du mar phye bas 'dres pa'i tshul ni grangs med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa rnam pa du mar phye bas 'dres pa'i tshul ni grangs med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the combinations are innumerable because of the many types of enumerations.

original: rtsis las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang // rim gyis bde bar 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: rtsis las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang // rim gyis bde bar 'gyur ba las //

analyzed: rtogs dka' yin te yang yang brtag / ma yengs pas ni shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /

original: 'dres pa'i nad de srog ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa'i dbye bas phye ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' zhing shes par mi nus pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i nad de srog ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa'i dbye bas phye ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' zhing shes par mi nus pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: The life-force and so forth are the characteristics of the humors that are difficult to understand and impossible to know in their infinite divisions.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i tshul rang rang gi nad kyi rtags ji ltar byung ba dang / rim gyis bde bar 'gyur ba ste /🔽zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi nye bar sbyor ba dang / rang nyid kyis goms par gyur pa las rtogs par dka' ba yin du zin kyang yang dang yang du brtag par bya zhing sman pas ma yengs shing de shes pa la @189a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i tshul rang rang gi nad kyi rtags ji ltar byung ba dang / rim gyis bde bar 'gyur ba ste / zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi nye bar sbyor ba dang / rang nyid kyis goms par gyur pa las rtogs par dka' ba yin du zin kyang yang dang yang du brtag par bya zhing sman pas ma yengs shing de shes pa la @189a * //
translated: However, the way in which their individual characteristics arise, the way in which the signs of their individual illnesses arise, and the way in which they gradually become well,🔽are difficult to understand, even though they are known through the application of various diets, conduct, and so forth, and through one’s own experience.

original: brtson par sems gzhan du ma 'phyos par shes shing rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson par sems gzhan du ma 'phyos par shes shing rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the physician should examine them again and again, and should understand and know them with a mind that is not distracted and that is diligent in understanding them.

original: khyad par srog ni 'tsho ba yin //
analyzed: khyad par srog ni 'tsho ba yin //
translated: In particular, the life-force is life.

original: stod du rgyu ba stobs zhes brjod //
analyzed: stod du rgyu ba stobs zhes brjod //

original: de gnyis gnod par gyur pa las //
analyzed: de gnyis gnod par gyur pa las //

original: tshe dang stobs ni zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe dang stobs ni zad par 'gyur //
translated: life and strength are exhausted.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽khyad par ram mchog tu rlung thams cad las srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni 'tsho ba zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / khyad par ram mchog tu rlung thams cad las srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni 'tsho ba zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: stod du rgyu ba'i rlung ni stobs zhes bya ba yin par brjod do //

original: rlung ni 'dres pa ma shes pa'am //
analyzed: rlung ni 'dres pa ma shes pa'am //
translated: The wind is mixed and not recognized,

original: shes kyang lo gcig lon pa ni //🔽'bad kyang gso dka' yin pa'am //
analyzed: shes kyang lo gcig lon pa ni // 'bad kyang gso dka' yin pa'am //

original: gso ba'i thabs ni med pa yin //
analyzed: gso ba'i thabs ni med pa yin //
translated: or there is no method of cure.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: srog ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rlung phan tshun 'dres par gyur pa'am /

analyzed: re re mkhris pa la sogs pa dang 'dres pa las 'dren ma du mar gyur pa las de ma shes shing ma rtogs pa'am /

analyzed: yang na rnam pa thams cad du gso ba'i thabs med pa yin no //

analyzed: de bas na 'dren ma de ni nges pas brtag cing shes par bya dgos so //

analyzed: 'dres nad yal bar bor na ni //

analyzed: khong 'bras mcher pa snying nad dang // skran dang me drod nyams la sogs // bla brnan de las 'byung bar 'gyur //

analyzed: rlung gi 'dren med dag yal bar bor zhing gso bar ma byas na /

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas nges par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas nges par sbyar ba las /

analyzed: dang po nad ni yongs brtags la ; / de rjes sman ni brtag bya zhing //

analyzed: rims kyis nyes pa skyed byed pas //

analyzed: sngon tshul byung dang rims sogs la'ang //

analyzed: de phyir smyung ba bya dgos la //

analyzed: rims la sogs pa gsal ba nyid du snang na yang smyung ba bya zhing /

analyzed: nad pa'i nyams stobs 'bad pas bsrung zhing bskyang bar bya'o //

analyzed: stobs ni nad med pa yi gnas //

analyzed: bya ba'i rims ni nad med don //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: smyung byas nad ni nyams smad cing //

analyzed: me drod skyed dang khong yang 'gyur //

original: de la phal cher bad kan nad //
analyzed: de la phal cher bad kan nad //

analyzed: khyad par du ni ma zhur 'byung //

analyzed: skyug sman btang 'os skyug sman bsngags //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: de yang gang zhig la gtang zhe na /
translated: What is it for?

original: skyug sman btang bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: skyug sman btang bar 'os pa ste /
translated: It is for those who are suitable for emetic medicine.

original: sngar skyug sman btang ba'i cho ga'i skabs su bshad pa'i skyug sman btang bar 'os pa la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar skyug sman btang ba'i cho ga'i skabs su bshad pa'i skyug sman btang bar 'os pa la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: It should be given to those who are suitable for emetic medicine, as explained in the section on the procedure for giving emetic medicine.

original: de las gzhan du byas na ni //🔽dbugs mi bde dang tshad 'khru slon //
analyzed: de las gzhan du byas na ni // dbugs mi bde dang tshad 'khru slon //
translated: If done otherwise,🔽it causes dyspnea and diarrhea,

original: snying nad mi bzad rims kyis 'debs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying nad mi bzad rims kyis 'debs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: and unbearable heart disease and fever.

original: skyug sman btang ba dang ; de las gzhan pa ste nad ma glongs pa la sogs pa'i tshul btang bar gyur na dbugs mi bde ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyug sman btang ba dang ; de las gzhan pa ste nad ma glongs pa la sogs pa'i tshul btang bar gyur na dbugs mi bde ba la sogs pa'i nad kyis 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives emetics, or if one gives other medicines, or if one does not give medicines when the disease is not cured, one will be afflicted with diseases such as dyspnea.🔽Take a decoction of the three spices,

original: po son pi pi ling bcas pa //🔽dug mo yungs sam shing mngar ni //
analyzed: po son pi pi ling bcas pa // dug mo yungs sam shing mngar ni //
translated: long pepper, and white-flowered leadwort,🔽with hot water, honey, and sugar,

original: chu dron sbrang rtsir bcas pa'am //🔽yang na rgya mtshar ldan pa blud ;🔽/ kar ka ta 'am pa to la //🔽nim pa spa yi lo ma'i chu'am //
analyzed: chu dron sbrang rtsir bcas pa'am // yang na rgya mtshar ldan pa blud ; / kar ka ta 'am pa to la // nim pa spa yi lo ma'i chu'am //
translated: or with sea salt.🔽Take a decoction of the three spices,🔽long pepper, and neem leaves,

original: 'bras yos kyi ni skyo ma'am //
analyzed: 'bras yos kyi ni skyo ma'am //
translated: or a decoction of parched rice,

original: bu ram shing khu'ang chang sbyar btung //
analyzed: bu ram shing khu'ang chang sbyar btung //
translated: or sugarcane juice mixed with wine.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽de la po son cha ni ma dan pha la ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / de la po son cha ni ma dan pha la ste /
translated: As for that,

original: de pi pi ling la sogs pa dang bcas shing sbyar ba dang / yang na dug mo nyung te /
analyzed: de pi pi ling la sogs pa dang bcas shing sbyar ba dang / yang na dug mo nyung te /
translated: the three spices are cardamom, cumin, and black pepper.

original: aindra @190b ya ba dang bcas pa dang / yang na shing mngar zhes pa ma du yashti dang bcas pa dang / chu dron zhes pa chu dro 'jam tsam dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba blud pa'am /
analyzed: aindra @190b ya ba dang bcas pa dang / yang na shing mngar zhes pa ma du yashti dang bcas pa dang / chu dron zhes pa chu dro 'jam tsam dang sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba blud pa'am /
translated: or with indrayava, or with madhuka and madhuyashti, or with a decoction of warm water and honey.🔽

original: yang na rgyam tsha dang bcas pa'i chu dron po dag blud par bya'o //🔽yang na kar ka ta la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i lo ma bskol ba'i chu dang sbyar ba btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyam tsha dang bcas pa'i chu dron po dag blud par bya'o // yang na kar ka ta la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i lo ma bskol ba'i chu dang sbyar ba btung bar bya'o //
translated: Or one should give a drink of warm water with sugar and honey, or warm water with rock salt.

original: yang na 'bras yos las byas pa'i skyo ma'am /
analyzed: yang na 'bras yos las byas pa'i skyo ma'am /
translated: Or one should drink water boiled with the leaves of any suitable plant such as the karavira.🔽Or one should drink a gruel made from parched rice,

original: bu ram shing gi khu ba'am /
analyzed: bu ram shing gi khu ba'am /
translated: or sugarcane juice,

original: chang sna tshogs pa ji ltar 'os pa dang po son cha blud par bya'o //
analyzed: chang sna tshogs pa ji ltar 'os pa dang po son cha blud par bya'o //
translated: or various kinds of suitable wine.

original: nyams stobs dus kyi dbye shes pas //🔽cho ga'i gnas las bshad pa yi //
analyzed: nyams stobs dus kyi dbye shes pas // cho ga'i gnas las bshad pa yi //
translated: Knowing the time for nourishing,🔽one should administer emetics

original: skyug sman dag ni rab tu gtang //
analyzed: skyug sman dag ni rab tu gtang //
translated: as explained in the authoritative texts.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: nyams stobs dang dus kyi dbye ba shes pa'i sman pa gang yin pa des cho ga'i gnas las bshad pa ste skyug sman dag gtang zhing sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams stobs dang dus kyi dbye ba shes pa'i sman pa gang yin pa des cho ga'i gnas las bshad pa ste skyug sman dag gtang zhing sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The physician who knows the strength of the humors and the divisions of time should administer emetics according to the rules explained in the treatises.

original: skyug sman gyi ni sbyor ba dag / byas par gyur tam ma byas kyang //
analyzed: skyug sman gyi ni sbyor ba dag / byas par gyur tam ma byas kyang //
translated: Whether the preparation of emetics is done or not,

original: rims nad can la rnam sbyang bya //
analyzed: rims nad can la rnam sbyang bya //
translated: purification should be done for those with fever.🔽When the humors are agitated,

original: nad ni bskyod par gyur pa dag / smin dang zhi bar bya phyir bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad ni bskyod par gyur pa dag / smin dang zhi bar bya phyir bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: they should be ripened and pacified.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i cho gas skyug sman gyi sbyor ba byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung rims nad can gyi skyes bu la smyung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyang ba'i cho ga bya ste /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i cho gas skyug sman gyi sbyor ba byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung rims nad can gyi skyes bu la smyung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par sbyang ba'i cho ga bya ste /
translated: Here, whether the preparation of emetics explained just now is done or not, purification rituals such as fasting should be done for a person with fever.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rims skyed par byed pa'i nad glongs shing bskyod par bya ba dag smin cing ma zhu ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang zhi zhing bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par sbyang ba'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: rims skyed par byed pa'i nad glongs shing bskyod par bya ba dag smin cing ma zhu ba med par bya ba'i phyir dang zhi zhing bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par sbyang ba'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: One should perform the purification rite in order to ripen and eliminate the diseases that cause fever and to digest and eliminate undigested food.

original: thal bas g-yogs pa'i me bzhin du //
analyzed: thal bas g-yogs pa'i me bzhin du //
translated: Like fire covered with ashes,

original: ma zhus khebs zas 'ju mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma zhus khebs zas 'ju mi 'gyur //
translated: food is not digested when covered by indigestion.

original: de bas nyes pa smin bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas nyes pa smin bya'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, in order to ripen the faults,

original: rims dang ldan la smyung ba bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rims dang ldan la smyung ba bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should fast for one with fever.

original: pho ba'i me drod rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi skyon gzhan gyis g-yogs shing khebs par gyur na zas 'ju bar byed mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi skyon gzhan gyis g-yogs shing khebs par gyur na zas 'ju bar byed mi nus pa ste /
translated: Here, if the digestive heat of the stomach is covered and obscured by other faults of wind and so on, it is unable to digest food.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi me thal bas g-yogs par gyur na dngos po 'tshed cing smin par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi me thal bas g-yogs par gyur na dngos po 'tshed cing smin par byed mi nus so //
translated: For example, if external fire is covered with ashes, it is unable to cook and ripen things.

original: de bzhin du nang gi me yang ma zhu bas khebs shing g-yogs na zas 'ju bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi me yang ma zhu bas khebs shing g-yogs na zas 'ju bar mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, if internal fire is covered and obscured by indigestion, it is unable to digest food.

original: de bas na rims dang ldan pa'i mi la ni dang po kho nar smyung ba bya ba gces te /
analyzed: de bas na rims dang ldan pa'i mi la ni dang po kho nar smyung ba bya ba gces te /
translated: Therefore, for a person who has a fever, fasting is essential from the very beginning.

original: de yang nad kyi nyes pa smin par gyur gyi bar du bya zhing nad ma zhu ba med par gyur gyi bar du de la smyung ba bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nad kyi nyes pa smin par gyur gyi bar du bya zhing nad ma zhu ba med par gyur gyi bar du de la smyung ba bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should fast until the faults of the illness have ripened, and until the illness has been digested.

original: rlung dang bad kan rims skom dang // @191a * //
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan rims skom dang // @191a * //
translated: For wind, bile, and phlegm fevers,

original: chu tshan nyung shas nyung shas btung //🔽des ni bad kan zhu gyur nas //
analyzed: chu tshan nyung shas nyung shas btung // des ni bad kan zhu gyur nas //
translated: drink a little warm water.🔽That will digest the phlegm,

original: skom dang myur du sel bar byed //
analyzed: skom dang myur du sel bar byed //
translated: and quickly relieve the thirst.

original: me drod skyed cing bu ga'i rgyun //
analyzed: me drod skyed cing bu ga'i rgyun //
translated: It generates digestive heat,

original: 'jam par byas nas sbyong bar byed //🔽zhen pa'i rlung mkhris rdul dang ni //
analyzed: 'jam par byas nas sbyong bar byed // zhen pa'i rlung mkhris rdul dang ni //
translated: and after softening the channels, it cleans them.🔽It easily expels the wind, bile, and the impurities,

original: bshang gci bde bar 'byin par byed //
analyzed: bshang gci bde bar 'byin par byed //
translated: as well as feces and urine.

original: gnyid rmongs yi ga 'chus pa sel //
analyzed: gnyid rmongs yi ga 'chus pa sel //
translated: It removes sleepiness, confusion, and loss of appetite,

original: srog ni 'dzin par byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srog ni 'dzin par byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and it sustains life.

original: rlung dang bad kan gyi rims la nad pa skom dad skyes par gyur na chu bskol btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan gyi rims la nad pa skom dad skyes par gyur na chu bskol btung bar bya ste /
translated: In the case of wind and phlegm fevers, if the patient is thirsty, he should drink boiled water.

original: de yang chu tshan nyung shas cung zhig btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chu tshan nyung shas cung zhig btung bar bya'o //
translated: Drink a small amount of hot water.

original: des ci zhig byed ce na /🔽chu tshan des rtsa spubs kyi rgyun srang 'gag par byed pa'i bad kan 'thas pa'i tshul du gnas pa des zhu zhing sla ba'i tshul du byas nas skom dad gang yin pa de myur du sel zhing ldog par byed do //
analyzed: des ci zhig byed ce na / chu tshan des rtsa spubs kyi rgyun srang 'gag par byed pa'i bad kan 'thas pa'i tshul du gnas pa des zhu zhing sla ba'i tshul du byas nas skom dad gang yin pa de myur du sel zhing ldog par byed do //
translated: What does that do?🔽That hot water dissolves the phlegm that is located like a blockage in the channels and the vessels, and by making it soft, it quickly removes and stops whatever thirst there is.

original: de bzhin du pho ba'i me drod kyang bskyed cing sbar nas nang gi bu ga'i rgyun gang dag yin pa de 'jam zhing mnyen par byas nas bu ga de dag nyid sbyong zhing dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du zhen cing bu ga'i sgo rnams su chags pa'i rlung la sogs pa bde bar 'byin par byed cing lugs dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pho ba'i me drod kyang bskyed cing sbar nas nang gi bu ga'i rgyun gang dag yin pa de 'jam zhing mnyen par byas nas bu ga de dag nyid sbyong zhing dag par byed pa dang / de bzhin du zhen cing bu ga'i sgo rnams su chags pa'i rlung la sogs pa bde bar 'byin par byed cing lugs dang mthun par 'byung bar byed pa dang /
translated: In the same way, it also generates and ignites the digestive heat in the stomach, and having made the channels and the vessels soft and pliable, it cleans and purifies those channels and vessels. In the same way, it easily expels the wind and so forth that are stuck and attached at the openings of the channels, and it causes them to arise in a natural way.

original: de bzhin du gnyid dang rmongs bag la sogs pa sel bar byed pa dang / srog 'dzin cing gnas pa yin la de tshim par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid dang rmongs bag la sogs pa sel bar byed pa dang / srog 'dzin cing gnas pa yin la de tshim par byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, it is the life-force, because it is the support of sleep, delusion, and so forth, and it is the life-force, because it is the support of life and existence.

original: chu grang de las bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: chu grang de las bzlog pa ste //
translated: Hot water is the opposite of that.

original: nad kyi tshogs ni 'phel byed yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nad kyi tshogs ni 'phel byed yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It increases the mass of diseases.

original: chu grang ni chu tshan gyi yon tan de las go bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin zhing /
analyzed: chu grang ni chu tshan gyi yon tan de las go bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin zhing /
translated: Hot water has the characteristics opposite to those of hot water.

original: nad kyi tshogs gang dag yod pa de 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nad kyi tshogs gang dag yod pa de 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pa yin no //
translated: It increases and expands the mass of whatever diseases exist.

original: chu tshan yon tan de 'dra yang //🔽gcig tu mkhris pas ldan rims dang // mkhris shas che dang phyogs gcig tsha //
analyzed: chu tshan yon tan de 'dra yang // gcig tu mkhris pas ldan rims dang // mkhris shas che dang phyogs gcig tsha //
translated: Hot water has such qualities,🔽but it is not suitable for those with a predominance of bile,🔽those with an excess of bile, those with a one-sided fever,

original: kun tsha rmongs bag tshad par 'khru //🔽chang dub las byung so ga dang // gcong skem khrag mkhris can mi blud //
analyzed: kun tsha rmongs bag tshad par 'khru // chang dub las byung so ga dang // gcong skem khrag mkhris can mi blud //
translated: those with a fever in all parts, those with delusion, and those with indigestion.🔽It should not be drunk by those who are exhausted from alcohol,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: those with chronic fever, and those with blood and bile disorders.

original: chu tshan bshad ma thag pa'i yon tan bad kan zhu bar gyur pa dang / me drod skyed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang gcig tu mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rims dang ldan pa'i mi dang nad gzhan dag mkhris pa shas che zhing rgyas pa dang ldan pa dang /🔽@191b phyogs gcig tsha ba la sogs pa'i nad de /
analyzed: chu tshan bshad ma thag pa'i yon tan bad kan zhu bar gyur pa dang / me drod skyed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa yin du zin kyang gcig tu mkhris pa las gyur pa'i rims dang ldan pa'i mi dang nad gzhan dag mkhris pa shas che zhing rgyas pa dang ldan pa dang / @191b phyogs gcig tsha ba la sogs pa'i nad de /
translated: Although hot water has the qualities of digesting phlegm and increasing digestive heat, it should not be given to those with a single type of fever due to excessive bile, or to those with other diseases of increased bile.

original: de la phyogs gcig tsha ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po tsha ba dang / kun tshab ste lus thams cad tsha ba dang / de bzhin du chang dang dug gnyis las byung ba'i rims la chu tshan de blud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig tsha ba ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po tsha ba dang / kun tshab ste lus thams cad tsha ba dang / de bzhin du chang dang dug gnyis las byung ba'i rims la chu tshan de blud par mi bya'o //
translated: In one type of fever, the sense faculties such as the eyes are hot, and in the other type, the whole body is hot. Hot water should not be given for fevers arising from alcohol or poison.

original: de bzhin du so ga'i dus su'ang rang bzhin gyi chu tshan btung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du so ga'i dus su'ang rang bzhin gyi chu tshan btung du mi rung ngo //
translated: Similarly, hot water is not suitable to drink in the spring season.

original: de bzhin du gcong chen pos thebs te skems par gyur pa'i skyes bu dang / khrag mkhris las gyur pa'i nad yod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcong chen pos thebs te skems par gyur pa'i skyes bu dang / khrag mkhris las gyur pa'i nad yod pa ste /
translated: Likewise, a person who is afflicted with a serious illness, or who has a disease of blood or bile,

original: de dag la skom dad yod du zin kyang chu tshan blud du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dag la skom dad yod du zin kyang chu tshan blud du mi rung ngo //
translated: even though he has a thirst, should not be given hot water to drink.

original: de dag la ci zhig sbyin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la ci zhig sbyin zhe na /
translated: What should be given to them?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽For that, give boiled water with ginger,

original: de la gla sgang tsandan dang // bca' sga par pa ta dang ni //
analyzed: de la gla sgang tsandan dang // bca' sga par pa ta dang ni //
translated: candana, chaga, parpata,

original: pu shel tse dang ba le ka //
analyzed: pu shel tse dang ba le ka //
translated: pusheltse, and balaka.

original: bskol chu bsgrangs blud rims skom sel //
analyzed: bskol chu bsgrangs blud rims skom sel //
translated: This cures fever and thirst.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gcig tu mkhris pa'i nad yod pa la sogs pa de dag la ni gla sgang la sogs pa dang / bskol ba'i tshu bsgrangs pa phan te /
analyzed: gcig tu mkhris pa'i nad yod pa la sogs pa de dag la ni gla sgang la sogs pa dang / bskol ba'i tshu bsgrangs pa phan te /
translated: for those who have a disease of only bile, etc., boiled water with ginger, etc., is beneficial.

original: de ni rims dang skom dad sel ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rims dang skom dad sel ba yin no //
translated: This cures fever and thirst.

original: 'dir chu dang sman dag gi tshad ni gzhung gzhan dag las bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir chu dang sman dag gi tshad ni gzhung gzhan dag las bstan te /
translated: Here, the measure of water and medicine is taught in other texts:

original: gang zhig chur bskol bsgrangs gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig chur bskol bsgrangs gyur pa //
translated: That which is boiled and strained

original: gla sgang la sogs pa to la //
analyzed: gla sgang la sogs pa to la //
translated: with ginger, etc.

original: yan lag drug pa la sogs sbyar //
analyzed: yan lag drug pa la sogs sbyar //
translated: The six limbs and so on are applied.

original: de las zho re bcu gnas ni //
analyzed: de las zho re bcu gnas ni //
translated: From that, the curd is ten times the water.

original: chu ni bre gang nang du bskol //
analyzed: chu ni bre gang nang du bskol //
translated: One drona of water is boiled.

original: de nas bzhi cha lus byas te //
analyzed: de nas bzhi cha lus byas te //
translated: Then, having reduced it to one fourth,

original: skom dad la sogs zhi phyir btung /
analyzed: skom dad la sogs zhi phyir btung /
translated: it is drunk to pacify thirst and so on.

original: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag las kyang /🔽sman mang bskol ba ska ba yin //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang / de bzhin du gzhan dag las kyang / sman mang bskol ba ska ba yin //
translated: And similarly, it is also stated in other texts:🔽The decoction of many medicines is thick.

original: sman nyung chu bskol dangs ma yin //
analyzed: sman nyung chu bskol dangs ma yin //
translated: The decoction of few medicines is clear.

original: zhes smos pa yin no //🔽mkhris pa med par tsha mi 'byung //
analyzed: zhes smos pa yin no // mkhris pa med par tsha mi 'byung //
translated: This is what is said.🔽Without bile, heat does not occur.

original: tsha ba med par rims yod min //
analyzed: tsha ba med par rims yod min //
translated: Without heat, fever does not exist.

original: de bas mkhris pa la gnod spang //
analyzed: de bas mkhris pa la gnod spang //
translated: Therefore, avoid harming bile.

original: mkhris shas che bas lhag par spang //
analyzed: mkhris shas che bas lhag par spang //
translated: Especially avoid it if bile is predominant.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rims nad thams cad la ni mkhris pa med cing de ma gtogs par tsha ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rims nad thams cad la ni mkhris pa med cing de ma gtogs par tsha ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: For all fevers, without bile, heat does not occur.

original: tsha ba ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rims la tsha ba gang dag yod pa de ni mkhris pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: tsha ba ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin las byung ba yin pa'i phyir rims la tsha ba gang dag yod pa de ni mkhris pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Heat arises from the nature of bile, so the heat that exists in fevers is born from bile.

original: tsha ba de med par yang rims yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tsha ba de med par yang rims yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And fever does not exist without heat.

original: gang gi phyir rims kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dang po tsha ba 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na mkhris pa la gnod pa'i kha zas dang spyod lam dang sman mkhris pa skyed par byed pa'i rims @192a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rims kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dang po tsha ba 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de bas na mkhris pa la gnod pa'i kha zas dang spyod lam dang sman mkhris pa skyed par byed pa'i rims @192a * //
translated: Because the characteristic of the essential nature of fever is the first appearance of heat.

original: thams cad la yang phal cher spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la yang phal cher spang bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, food, conduct, and medicine that harm bile and increase bile should be mostly avoided in all fevers.

original: de las kyang mkhris pa shas che zhing mkhris pa rgyas pa las gyur pa'i rims la ni mkhris pa skyed par byed pa de lhag par yang spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las kyang mkhris pa shas che zhing mkhris pa rgyas pa las gyur pa'i rims la ni mkhris pa skyed par byed pa de lhag par yang spang bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in fevers that are predominantly and excessively of the bile type, those that increase bile should be especially avoided.
